intro: Acourtia scapiformis, commonly known as the scapiform acourtia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and produces small, yellowish to brownish flowers. Its leaves are usually narrow and linear, adapted to reduce water loss in arid environments. Acourtia scapiformis is often found in chaparral and coastal scrub ecosystems.
